Intron-exon organization and functional analysis of 5'-flanking region .

<extra_id_0> Interferon regulatory factor 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a transcriptional regulatory protein that terminates <extra_id_0> interferon beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression initiated by <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In this study , we isolated the genomic DNA for human <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , determined the intron-exon structure of the human <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , mapped the major transcription initiation site , identified a number of potential regulatory elements in the 5'-flanking region , and localized the <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene on human chromosome 4 .
The <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter region contains a CpG island , with several GC boxes , a putative NF-kappa B - binding site , and a CAAT box , but no TATA box .

When the promoter region was linked with a heterologous reporter gene , we found that the promoter region is inducible by both interferons ( <extra_id_0> interferon-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> -gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The region which induced these inductions was identified as being confined to 40 nucleotides 5 ' to the major transcriptional initiation site by testing a series of clones with truncated promoter of <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

This region contains elements which are shared with the transcriptional enhancers of other genes including <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> interferon beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and interferon - inducible genes .

These data suggest that <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> not only triggers the activation of the interferon signal transduction pathway , but also may play a role in limiting the duration of this response by activating the transcription of <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
